title: faithfulness
comment: Commitment to a relationship with God or fellow human beings; seen in that loyalty, devotion and service which is a reflection of God's own faithfulness. Scripture points to the faithfulness of Jesus Christ as an example for believers.

children.title: faithfulness, to God
children.comment: The proper response to God by his covenant people; seen in a steadfast commitment which reflects God's own faithfulness to the covenant. Encouraged in all believers, it is especially important in leaders.

children.title: Faithfulness is the proper response to God by his covenant people
God's covenant with his people requires faithfulness
Faithfulness to God seen as marital fidelity
Faithfulness to God reflects God's faithfulness
Faithfulness is seen as steadfast commitment to God

secondaryrefs.comment: Faithfulness to God is expressed in giving to him for the benefit of others

children.title: Faithfulness is especially important in leaders
faithfulness, in human relationships
children.comment: Loyalty and commitment within human relationships is important in the life of God's people. It is seen particularly in fidelity within marriage, fulfilling family obligations, honouring vows, dutiful service and trustworthy speech and conduct.

children.title: It is important in the life of God's people

primaryrefs.comment: The word translated ``love'' is the Hebrew word ``hesed'', which here expresses the loyalty and faithfulness that should characterise the life of God's people.

children.title: It is a reflection of God's faithfulness to his people

seealsos.comment: fulfilling family obligations in marriage arrangements
Jesus Christ provides for his mother.

children.title: faithfulness, examples of
children.comment: Those who show loyalty, reliability and devotion in their relationships with God and others.

primaryrefs.comment: David, fleeing from Saul, shelters with Achish, king of Gath.
